benchmark_details.name: WikiContradict: A Benchmark for Evaluating LLMs on Real-World Knowledge Conflicts from Wikipedia
benchmark_details.overview: WikiContradict is a benchmark consisting of 253 high-quality, human-annotated instances designed to assess LLM performance when augmented with retrieved passages containing real-world knowledge conflicts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of LLMs on handling real-world knowledge conflicts.

methodology.calculation: Human evaluations yield metrics based on responses from LLMs to annotated instances.
methodology.interpretation: An answer is considered correct if it accurately reflects the contradictory nature of the passages.
methodology.validation: Moderate to substantial inter-annotator agreement on human evaluations.
